topic.title: Device Initialization API Details

body.p: The API discussed in this section are used for device initialization before datapaths are provisioned. The flowchart for device initialization is shown in Figure 1 below and the API are listed in Table 1.

note.p: The source file for the following diagram can be found at http://bby1dms01.pmc-sierra.internal/DocMgmt/getfile.cfm?file_id=444764 (sheet "Device_Init")

entry.p: Performs start up initialization of the underlying DIGI-G5 device.
Destroys the host information stored for device_id passed in.
Retrieves host and device status information.
Sets the error generation behavior when provisioning GFP applications.
Specifies the algorithm used to route SERDES pins to the internal ENET subsystem physical resources.
Sets the error generation behavior when provisioning ODTUjk multiplexing on the ODUCn group's Cn multiplexed payload.
Gets the current resource allocation on each ODTUjk instance that is reserved for the ODUCn group channel.

body.section:
g5_api_device_init()
Device initialization is performed with the g5_api_device_init() API. This function performs start up initialization of the underlying DIGI-G5 device. All SERDES port configuration, except those used for the Interlaken interface, must be done with the g5_api_serdes_port_los_cfg() API. The g5_api_device_init() API has the following parameters and associated enumerations or structures:
device_id
host_cfg - g5_config_t
The device_id parameter a unique identifier representing the underlying DIGI-G5 device.
The host_cfg parameter of the g5_api_device_init() API is the set of bring up configuration information to be applied to the device and is defined by the structure g5_config_t that has the following structure members with associated enumerations or structures:
device_info - g5_device_instance_t
ilkn_cfg - g5_ilkn_intf_common_t
ilkn_intf - g5_ilkn_intf_cfg_t
ilkn_lane - g5_ilkn_lane_cfg_t
pmon_data - g5_pmon_data_t
padding
refclk_rate - g5_refclk_rate_t
host_sdk_mode
init_type - g5_init_type_t
fw_filename
reserved
The device_info member of the structure g5_config_t is the device instance description that is defined by the g5_device_instance_t structure that has two members. The first member is base_address which is the device physical base address. The second member is name_ptr which is a string or other information that can be used to uniquely identify the device in the system.
The ilkn_cfg member of the structure g5_config_t is the common Interlaken configuration that applies to all interfaces and is defined by the g5_ilkn_intf_common_t structure that has the following members with associated enumerations or structures:
burst_max - g5_ilkn_burst_max_t
burst_min - g5_ilkn_burst_min_t
burst_short - g5_ilkn_burst_short_t
tx_header_mode - g5_ilkn_fabric_ingress_header_t
rx_header_mode - g5_ilkn_fabric_egress_header_t
rx_xoff_mode - g5_ilkn_rx_link_mode_t
The burst_max, burst_min and burst_short members of the structure g5_ilkn_intf_common_t are the defined by the enumerations g5_ilkn_burst_max_t, g5_ilkn_burst_min_t and g5_ilkn_burst_short_t that specify the Interlaken burst max, min and burst size. The burst_max size options are shown in Table 2 below. The burst_min size options are shown in Table 3below. The burst_short size options are shown in Table 4 below. g5_ilkn_burst_max_t Enumeration
Enumerator
Burst Size
G5_ILKN_BURST_MAX_128
128 byte burst size
G5_ILKN_BURST_MAX_256
256 byte burst size
G5_ILKN_BURST_MAX_512
512 byte burst size
g5_ilkn_burst_min_t Enumeration
Enumerator
Burst Size
G5_ILKN_BURST_MIN_DISABLED
No minimum burst size expected.
G5_ILKN_BURST_MIN_32
32 byte burst minimum
G5_ILKN_BURST_MIN_64
64 byte burst size
G5_ILKN_BURST_MIN_128
128 byte burst minimum
G5_ILKN_BURST_MIN_256
256 byte burst minimum
g5_ilkn_burst_short_t Enumeration
Enumerator
Burst Size
G5_ILKN_BURST_SHORT_32
32 byte burst size
G5_ILKN_BURST_SHORT_64
64 byte burst size
The tx_header_mode and rx_header_mode members of the structure g5_ilkn_intf_common_t are defined by the enumerations g5_ilkn_fabric_ingress_header_t and g5_ilkn_fabric_egress_header_t that specify the format of headers transferred between the Interlaken interface and the DCPB for the ODUK_CBRI traffic type. All headers will contain the Packet Maker Header and optionally a 'user specified overhead "2 bytes"' and/or 'user specified overhead "4 bytes"'. The tx_header_mode options are shown in Table 5 below. The rx_header_mode options are shown in Table 6 below. g5_ilkn_fabric_ingress_header_t Enumeration
Enumerator
Header Option
G5_ILKN_TX_HEADER_NONE
Optional Header 2B/4B not present.
G5_ILKN_TX_HEADER_2B
Optional Header 2B present.
G5_ILKN_TX_HEADER_4B
Optional Header 4B present.
G5_ILKN_TX_HEADER_2B_AND_4B
Both Header 2B and 4B present.
g5_ilkn_fabric_egress_header_t Enumeration
Enumerator
Header Option
G5_ILKN_RX_HEADER_NONE
Optional Header 2B/4B not present.
G5_ILKN_RX_HEADER_2B
Optional Header 2B present.
G5_ILKN_RX_HEADER_2B_CAM
Optional Header 2B present for CAM lookup.
G5_ILKN_RX_HEADER_4B
Optional Header 4B present.
G5_ILKN_RX_HEADER_4B_CAM
Optional Header 4B present with CAM lookup.
G5_ILKN_RX_HEADER_2B_AND_4B
Both Header 2B and 4B present.
G5_ILKN_RX_HEADER_2B_CAM_AND_4B
Both Header 2B CAM and 4B present.
The rx_xoff_mode member of the structure g5_ilkn_intf_common_t is the defined by the enumeration g5_ilkn_rx_link_mode_t that defines the behavior of the XOFF notification events to the flow control calendar for fabric egress channels. g5_ilkn_rx_link_mode_t has two enumerations: G5_ILKN_RX_LINK_MODE_PIF_ONLY and G5_ILKN_RX_LINK_MODE_HYBRID. G5_ILKN_RX_LINK_MODE_PIF_ONLY is used when only PIF sourced traffic is on the Interlaken interface. G5_ILKN_RX_LINK_MODE_HYBRID is used when both PIF and CBR sourced traffic is on the Interlaken interface.
The ilkn_intf member of the structure g5_config_t is the Interlaken Interface configuration that is defined by the g5_ilkn_intf_cfg_t structure that has the following members with associated enumerations or structures:
metaframe - g5_ilkn_mf_t
tx_rate_limit - g5_ilkn_tx_rate_limit_t
fc_enable
fc_cal_length
The metaframe member of the structure g5_ilkn_intf_cfg_t is defined by the enumeration g5_ilkn_mf_t that specifies the length of the Interlaken meta frame which includes the Synchronization, Scrambler State, Skip, and Diagnostic words carried on each Interlaken lane. The metaframe length options are shown in Table 7 below. g5_ilkn_mf_t Enumeration
Enumerator
Metaframe Length
G5_ILKN_MF_1024
1024 block meta frame length
G5_ILKN_MF_2048
2048 block meta frame length
G5_ILKN_MF_4096
4096 block meta frame length
The tx_rate_limit member of the structure g5_ilkn_intf_cfg_t is the defined by the structure g5_ilkn_tx_rate_limit_t that specifies an optional Interlaken transmit rate limit. The structure has three members: rate_limit, burst_limit and byte_granularity. The member rate_limit specifies the rate limit in 1 Gbps increments (from 0 to 100). When set to 0 the transmit rate limit is disabled. When set from 1 to 100, rate limiting is enabled to the limit value in Gbps. The burst_limit member is the maximum quantity of data that may be burst across the Interlaken interface before invoking the rate limiting logic (in bytes). The byte_granularity member is the number of credits that are to be subtracted from the token bucket when an EOP is encountered. The value of byte_granularity and number of bytes to be subtracted is shown below:
byte_granularity = 0 refers to 1 byte subtracted
byte_granularity = 1 refers to 2 bytes subtracted
byte_granularity = 2 refers to 4 bytes subtracted
byte_granularity = 3 refers to 8 bytes subtracted
byte_granularity = 4 refers to 16 bytes subtracted
byte_granularity = 5 refers to 32 bytes subtracted
The fc_enable member of the g5_ilkn_intf_cfg_t structure enables flow control for the Interlaken interface. When fc_enable is set to TRUE, 16-bit in-band flow control is used. When fc_enable is set to FALSE in-band flow control is disabled on the Interlaken interface. The fc_cal_length member of the g5_ilkn_intf_cfg_t structure is the number of entries in the flow control calendar. The range is 1 - 300.
The ilkn_lane member of the structure g5_config_t is the Interlaken lane configuration that is defined by the g5_ilkn_lane_cfg_t structure and has the following members with associated enumerations or structures:
rate - g5_ilkn_rate_t
serdes_port_ids_tx
serdes_port_ids_tx
The rate member of the structure g5_ilkn_lane_cfg_t is defined by the enumeration g5_ilkn_rate_t and is the SERDES rate for an Interlaken interface. The rate automatically determines whether FEC encoding is enabled or disabled. FEC encoding is always enabled for PAM4 rates. FEC encoding is always disabled for NRZ rates. Note: The PAM4 SERDES rate is only valid for 1x500G configurations. If 3x200G mode is deployed then one of the two NRZ rates must be used. The rate options are shown in Table 8 below. g5_ilkn_rate_t Enumeration
Enumerator
Interlaken Lane Rate
G5_ILKN_RATE_25G78125
25.78125 Gbps
G5_ILKN_RATE_28G125
28.125G Gbps
G5_ILKN_RATE_53G
53.125 Gbps
G5_ILKN_RATE_56G
56.25 Gbps
The serdes_port_ids_tx and serdes_port_ids_rx members of the g5_ilkn_lane_cfg_t structure are arrays defining the set of transmit and receive interface SERDES lanes used at the backplane interface of the Interlaken block. The member serdes_port_ids_rx must use the same set of serdes_port_id values used in serdes_port_ids_tx. The logical lane order in serdes_port_ids_tx and serdes_port_ids_rx may be different. The arrays have 24 elements where each index represents a logical lane. The data of each array index is the serdes_port_id corresponding to the device physical pin (legal range 0 to 71). Unused entries must be set to G5_MAX_INT.
The pmon_data member of the structure g5_config_t is the PMON configuration information and is defined by the g5_pmon_data_t structure. It holds basic operators such as the trigger type, the trigger period, etc used with PMON. By default all Boolean variables are set to FALSE and 1000 ms is set as the event reporting period. Note that the actual address block used to enable FW to pass back PMON data to the host is defined specifically in the OS porting layer and is not provided here. The g5_pmon_data_t structure has the following members with associated enumerations or structures:
auto_trigger
pmon_sync_enable
trigger_period_ms
The auto_trigger member of the g5_pmon_data_t structure selects the trigger type used for PMON. When set to TRUE, automatic PMON triggering is enabled. When set to FALSE, manual triggering is enabled.
The pmon_sync_enable member of the g5_pmon_data_t structure chooses whether to use the PMON_SYN_I input signal to trigger the PMON transfer. When set to TRUE, the PMON_SYN_I input signal is used. When set to FALSE, the PMON_SYN_I input signal is not used.
The trigger_period_ms member of the g5_pmon_data_t structure chooses the period, in milliseconds, between trigger events. The values are 250, 500 or 1000.
The padding member of the g5_config_t structure is padding to avoid uninitialized data.
The refclk_rate member of the g5_config_t structure selects the device REFCLK rate and has two enumerators: G5_REFCLK_RATE_125_MHZ to choose a 125 MHz reference clock and G5_REFCLK_RATE_155_MHZ to choose a 155 MHz reference clock.
The host_sdk_mode member of the g5_config_t structure is the DeviceID(i.e 6010) the host SDK is setup to configure.
The init_type member of the g5_config_t structure is the startup type of the device and is defined by the enumeration g5_init_type_t. The init_type options are shown in Table 9 below. g5_init_type_t Enumeration
Enumerator
Initialization Type
G5_INIT_COLD
Cold initialization
G5_INIT_RESTART
Restart of host - no firmware reload
G5_INIT_RESTART_FW_RELOAD
Restart of host - firmware reload/upgrade
The fw_filename member of the g5_config_t structure is the pointer to FW filename. This parameter is only used by host. The device will not use it. The reserved member of the g5_config_t structure is padding for 32bit pointer to maintain alignment.

section.title: g5_api_device_uninit()
section.p: The g5_api_device_uninit() API destroys the host information stored for device_id passed in. It also makes the calls to stop DMA transfers (PMON, Log, defects), frees shared memory, and calls porting functions to unmap the device. It will optionally reset the device or leave running. The g5_api_device_uninit() API has the following parameters and associated enumerations or structures:

The device_id parameter is the unique device identity. The shutdown parameter is a Boolean to choose if the device is shutdown or not. When set to TRUE, the device is shutdown. When set to FALSE, the device is not shutdown.

section.title: g5_api_status_get()
section.p: The g5_api_status_get() API retrieves host and device status information. Retrieves the current firmware and software version and revision values. Build target information and the hardware revision. All updates are added to the status_ptr reference parameter. The g5_api_status_get() API has the following parameters and associated enumerations or structures:
The API returns a pointer to the status info, status_ptr, that is defined by the g5_status_info_t structure. The g5_status_info_t structure has the following associated enumerations or structures:

The build_code member of the g5_status_info_t structure is the device identification or target the software code was built for. It should be compatible with the device_type member of the g5_device_status_info_t structure.
The device_info member of the g5_status_info_t structure is defined by the g5_device_status_info_t structure that has the following members:

The device_type member of the g5_device_status_info_t structure is the device identification code and is the same or compatible with the product code. The device_revision member is read from the device and is based on the revision type. The fw_alive member is a flag indicating that the firmware is valid. The fw_revision member is a source control revision number. The fw_version member is the version number of the firmware running on the device.

The pcie_connected member of the g5_status_info_t structure is an indication of whether the connection between the host and the device is active. The sw_fw_mismatch member is an indication of whether the software and firmware are compatible. The sw_revision member is the host processor source control revision number. The sw_version member is the version of software running on the host processor.

section.title: g5_api_gfp_non_blocking_set()
section.p: The g5_api_device_uninit() API sets the error generation behavior when provisioning GFP applications. By default an error code will be generated by the g5_api_client_map_cfg() API if the bandwidth used by GFP applications would exceed the non-blocking bandwidth threshold. This API controls if an ERROR code is generated for cases where the same rate GFP applications are being configured such as 5 x 100GE or 50 x 10GE. In these cases provisioning will successfully pass until the resources within the GFP slice boundaries are no longer available. When the resources are used up an error will be generated by default. The g5_api_gfp_non_blocking_set() API has the following parameters and associated enumerations or structures:

The device_id parameter is the unique device identity. The enable parameter is a BOOLEAN to choose the GFP non-blocking ERROR code insertion mode. When set to TRUE: Error codes are generated when the GFP provisioned non-blocking bandwidth is exceeded. When set to FALSE: Error codes are not generated when the GFP provisioned non-blocking bandwidth is exceeded.

section.title: g5_api_enet_serdes_route_set()
section.p: The g5_api_enet_serdes_route_set() API specifies the algorithm used to route SERDES pins to the internal ENET subsystem physical resources. If the current provisioned ENET applications have SERDES to ENET routing which does not match the route mode, then an error code is returned. The g5_api_enet_serdes_route_set() API has the following parameters and associated enumerations or structures:
The device_id parameter is the unique device identity.
The route parameter selects the SERDES pin to ENET physical resource routing algorithm type using the g5_enet_serdes_route_t enumeration. The route options are shown in below.

entry.p: 10/25G and 10/25/53G without 400GE SERDES to Ethernet Routing

section.title: g5_api_jk_muxing_non_blocking_set()
section.p: The g5_api_jk_muxing_non_blocking_set() API sets the error generation behavior when provisioning ODTUjk multiplexing on the ODUCn group's Cn multiplexed payload. By default an error code will be generated by g5_api_odu_mux_cfg() if the bandwidth used by OTUjk multiplexing applications would exceed the non-blocking bandwidth threshold. The non-blocking ODTUjk bandwidth threshold is as follows:

li.p: For ODUC1 and ODUC2 group's payload: 100G
For ODUC3 and ODUC4 group's payload: 200G
For ODUC5 and ODUC6 group's payload: 300G

section.p: This API allows the ERROR code to not be generated in cases where same ODUk rate applications are being multiplexed into the ODUCn group's Cn multiplexed LO payload. For example, provisioning 10 x ODU2s into each ODU4 of an ODUC6 channel is allowed. In these cases provisioning can successfully pass until resources within the ODTUjk multiplexer slice boundaries are not available. At this time a scheduler availability error code will be generated. The g5_api_jk_muxing_non_blocking_set() API has the following parameters and associated enumerations or structures:
The device_id parameter is the unique device identity.

The enable parameter selects if an error code is generated or not. When set to TRUE an error code is generated when the non-blocking bandwidth is exceeded. When set to FALSE an error code is not generated if the non-blocking bandwidth is exceeded.

section.title: g5_api_cn_grp_jk_alloc_get()
section.p: The g5_api_cn_grp_jk_alloc_get() API gets the current resource allocation on each ODTUjk instance that is reserved for the ODUCn group channel. This API also returns the total number of free slots in ODUCn group channel. When provisioning a Cn demultiplexed HO ODUk, HO ODU1/ODU2/ODU3/ODU4 requires 2/8/32/80 1.25G slots respectively. The g5_api_cn_grp_jk_alloc_get() API has the following input parameters and associated enumerations or structures:
The device_id parameter is the unique device identity. The chnl_id parameters is the ODUCn group channel ID.
The API has returns the following output pointers:
The grp_free_slots_ptr pointer is the number of total free slots in the ODUCn group in 1.25G units.

The jk_inst_free_slots_ptr is a pointer to the array jk_inst_free_slots_ptr[0:5]. Each element of the array represents the number of free slots in each ODTUjk instance in 1.25G units. The maximum possible free slots in each ODTUjk instance is 96 which equals 120G. For array indicies that are not in the group, the number will be set to 0xFF. e.g.) For an ODUC3 group, indicies 0-2 are valid. indicies 3-5 will be set to 0xFF. The array rows are as follows:
